title: FullStack Software Engineer (Java/ Python)
job_function: Project Management, Design, and Information Technology
description:
**Job Location**
 HYDERABAD OFFICE APAC
   

  

**Job Description**
 We‚Äôre looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer to join our Data \\& Analytics Platforms engineering team. We are searching for self\\-motivated candidates, who will demonstrate modern Agile and DevOps practices to own the design and development of IT systems and applications, delivering global projects in multinational teams.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Leading engineering work for applications throughout its entire lifecycle from development, deployment, upgrade and replacement/termination
* Writing and testing code for Data \\& Analytics applications and building E2E cloud native (Azure) solutions
* Ensuring that development and architecture enforce to established standards, including modern software engineering practices (CICD, Agile, DevOps)
* Collaborate with internal technical specialists and with vendors to develop final product to improve overall performance, efficiency and/or to enable adaptation of new business process


**Job Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
* 3\\+ years of proven experience in writing code (Java, TypeScript) in similar role
* Experience working with Spring Framework, React
* Solid understanding of relational databases and SQL knowledge
* Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* A strong desire to produce high quality software through cross functional teamwork, testing, code reviews, and other standard methodologies
* Nice to have: Azure Cloud services, Python, Angular


**About Us**
 We produce globally recognized brands and we grow the best business leaders in the industry. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always¬Æ, Ariel¬Æ, Gillette¬Æ, Head \\& Shoulders¬Æ, Herbal Essences¬Æ, Oral\\-B¬Æ, Pampers¬Æ, Pantene¬Æ, Tampax¬Æ and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide. Visit http://www.pg.com to know more.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.
   

  

 "At P\\&G, the hiring journey is personalized every step of the way, thereby ensuring equal opportunities for all, with a strong foundation of Ethics \\& Corporate Responsibility guiding everything we do.
   

  

 All the available job opportunities are posted either on our website \\- pgcareers.com, or on our official social media pages, for the convenience of prospective candidates, and do not require them to pay any kind of fees towards their application.‚Äù
   

  

**Job Schedule**
 Full time
   

  

**Job Number**
 R000134935
   

  

**Job Segmentation**
 Experienced Professionals (Job Segmentation)

title: Software Engineer I
description:
*Ship real code on real infrastructure, powering behavioral AI at a global scale* 




  





**Company:** 
 Markopolo AI Inc.
 



**Experience:** 
 1‚Äì3 years
 



**Type:** 
 Full\\-Time (40 hours/week)
 



**Location:** 
 Remote / Hybrid ‚Äî Bangalore (India) or Dhaka (Bangladesh)
 



**Hybrid Policy:** 
 2 days in office, 3 days work from home
 



**Reports To:** 
 Engineering Lead / SWE II
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 Markopolo AI (markopolo.ai) is building the behavioral intelligence layer for the internet. Our flagship model, ATHENA‚Äîa 709M\\-parameter behavioral foundation model‚Äîpredicts what users will do 10‚Äì30 seconds before they act. Trained on 40M\\+ behavioral sequences across 603 independent businesses, ATHENA achieves 72\\.67% Top\\-1 accuracy on 116\\-class next\\-event prediction and runs at 0\\.01 ms inference latency via extreme compression (709M parameters ‚Üí 50KB WebAssembly). We are the ‚ÄúStripe for behavior‚Äù: foundational infrastructure powering real\\-time personalization, cart recovery, fraud detection, and the coming wave of agent\\-to\\-agent commerce. We are a small, intense team building something the world hasn‚Äôt seen before.
 



  





 We‚Äôre venture\\-backed by HF0 (investors in Ramp, Pave, Fabric, Clerk), Joa Capital (Saudi Sovereign Fund‚Äôs arm), and are headquartered in San Francisco, USA, with offices in Dhaka, Bangalore, and Riyadh.
 



  





 As a Software Engineer I, you will work across ATHENA‚Äôs full stack‚Äîfrom the browser\\-side SDK to the backend prediction pipeline. You‚Äôll ship features, fix real production issues, and learn how behavioral AI systems operate at scale. We move fast, we deploy daily, and every engineer‚Äôs code touches real users from day one. If you‚Äôre early in your career but build with intensity and curiosity, this is the role for you.
 



  





**WHAT YOU'LL DO** 



* Build and maintain features across the Athena tracker SDK, API layer, and data pipeline.
* Write clean, tested, production\\-grade code in Python and/or TypeScript.
* Implement and iterate on integrations with third\\-party platforms (Shopify, commerce APIs, n8n workflows).
* Assist in building and testing streaming data infrastructure (event ingestion, processing, storage).
* Debug and resolve production incidents with guidance from senior engineers.
* Write unit/integration tests and contribute to CI/CD pipeline improvements.
* Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and technical discussions.
* Document your work clearly ‚Äî we value engineers who write well.



  





**REQUIREMENTS** 



* 1‚Äì3 years of professional or significant project\\-based software engineering experience.
* Proficiency in Python and/or TypeScript/JavaScript.
* Understanding of web fundamentals: HTTP, REST APIs, browser events, DOM.
* Familiarity with at least one database (PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, MongoDB, or similar).
* Comfort with Git, CI/CD basics, and working in a collaborative engineering team.
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and a bias toward shipping working software.
* Good written communication skills.



  





**NICE TO HAVE** 



* Experience with real\\-time or event\\-driven systems.
* Familiarity with Docker, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP), or serverless deployments.
* Interest or coursework in machine learning, data engineering, or edge computing.
* Contributions to open\\-source projects or a strong personal project portfolio.



  





**WHY MARKOPOLO** 



* Work on a 709M\\-parameter behavioral foundation model (ATHENA) that predicts human actions before they happen ‚Äî real frontier AI, not wrapper products.
* Remote\\-first culture with hybrid flexibility (2 days in office, 3 days Work from home).
* Competitive compensation with equity options for full\\-time roles.
* Learn from a team pushing the boundaries of edge AI, model compression, and real\\-time behavioral intelligence.



  





**HOW TO APPLY‚ÄîWHAT WE WANT TO SEE** 




 We don‚Äôt care about your GPA. We care about what you‚Äôve built. Your application must include:
 



  





**üöÄ Your Most Impressive Vibe\\-Coded Project** 




 Share a link to a GitHub/GitLab repository of the most impressive project you‚Äôve built using vibe coding (AI\\-assisted development with tools like Cursor, Copilot, Claude, v0, Replit Agent, etc.). This can be:
 


* A side project, hackathon submission, freelance project, or personal tool.
* Any language, any stack, any domain. We‚Äôre looking for ambition, creativity, and execution quality.
* Include a README that explains what it does, what AI tools you used, what you learned, and what you‚Äôd improve.



  





*We want to see that you can leverage modern AI tools to build real software fast. Engineers who can ‚Äúvibe code‚Äù effectively multiply their output 5‚Äì10x ‚Äî that‚Äôs the kind of builder we want on the team.* 




  





**Ready to build the future of behavioral intelligence?** 




  





 Apply by sending your resume and the vibe\\-coded project repo to:
 



**hr@markopolo.ai**

description:

 We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Fresher Full\\-Stack Developer (0\\-2 Years) with

* Participate in code reviews and learn from feedback to improve coding skills

* Assist in API integration and testing to ensure seamless communication between frontend and backend
* Support debugging and troubleshooting issues across diÔ¨Äerent layers of the application

* internships

**What We OÔ¨Äer**

title: Software Engineer II
description:
*Build the behavioral intelligence infrastructure powering the future of commerce* 




  





**Company:** 
 Markopolo AI Inc.
 



**Experience:** 
 3‚Äì5 years
 



**Type:** 
 Full\\-Time (40 hours/week)
 



**Location:** 
 Remote / Hybrid ‚Äî Bangalore (India) or Dhaka (Bangladesh)
 



**Hybrid Policy:** 
 2 days in office, 3 days work from home
 



**Reports To:** 
 Engineering Lead
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 Markopolo AI (markopolo.ai) is building the behavioral intelligence layer for the internet. Our flagship model, ATHENA‚Äîa 709M\\-parameter behavioral foundation model‚Äîpredicts what users will do 10‚Äì30 seconds before they act. Trained on 40M\\+ behavioral sequences across 603 independent businesses, ATHENA achieves 72\\.67% Top\\-1 accuracy on 116\\-class next\\-event prediction and runs at 0\\.01 ms inference latency via extreme compression (709M parameters ‚Üí 50KB WebAssembly). We are the ‚ÄúStripe for behavior‚Äù: foundational infrastructure powering real\\-time personalization, cart recovery, fraud detection, and the coming wave of agent\\-to\\-agent commerce. We are a small, intense team building something the world hasn‚Äôt seen before.
 



  





 We‚Äôre venture\\-backed by HF0 (investors in Ramp, Pave, Fabric, Clerk), Joa Capital (Saudi Sovereign Fund‚Äôs arm), and are Headquartered in San Francisco, USA, with offices in Dhaka, Bangalore, and Riyadh.
 



  





 As a Software Engineer II, you will own and ship core systems that directly power ATHENA‚Äôs prediction pipeline, edge deployment infrastructure, and enterprise integrations. You won‚Äôt just write features‚Äîyou'll design systems that operate at sub\\-millisecond latency, handle millions of concurrent sessions, and compress state\\-of\\-the\\-art models into packages smaller than a JPEG. This role is for engineers who build things they‚Äôre proud of and want to work at the frontier of applied AI.
 



  





**WHAT YOU'LL DO** 



* Design, build, and own production systems within ATHENA‚Äôs real\\-time behavioral prediction pipeline.
* Architect and implement streaming data infrastructure (Kafka/Redpanda, ClickHouse, gRPC) for ingesting and processing millions of behavioral events per second.
* Develop and optimize edge\\-deployment systems: WebAssembly modules, model compression pipelines, and client\\-side inference engines.
* Build robust API surfaces and webhook/streaming integrations for enterprise customers and partner platforms (Stripe, Vercel, Shopify, n8n).
* Collaborate with the ML team on model serving infrastructure, A/B testing frameworks, and continuous training pipelines (Modal, PyTorch, TensorFlow Lite).
* Lead code reviews, contribute to architectural decisions, and mentor junior engineers and interns.
* Monitor, profile, and improve system performance targeting P99 latency \\< 50ms and 99\\.99% uptime.



  





**REQUIREMENTS** 



* 3‚Äì5 years of professional software engineering experience with production systems at scale.
* Strong proficiency in: Python, TypeScript/Node.js.
* Deep experience with distributed systems, streaming architectures, or real\\-time data pipelines.
* Solid understanding of system design: message queues, caching, load balancing, and database modeling.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Modal) and containerized deployments (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with ML model serving, inference optimization, or edge computing is strongly preferred.
* Strong debugging skills and comfort operating production systems under pressure.
* Excellent written and verbal communication; ability to write clear technical documentation.



  





**NICE TO HAVE** 



* Experience with WebAssembly, model quantization, or knowledge distillation.
* Background in behavioral analytics, session recording, or real\\-time personalization.
* Contributions to open\\-source projects or published technical writing.
* Experience building or integrating with payment infrastructure or commerce platforms.
* Familiarity with privacy\\-preserving architectures and client\\-side computation.



  





**HOW TO APPLY‚ÄîWHAT WE WANT TO SEE** 




 We don‚Äôt believe in LeetCode marathons. We believe in seeing how you think and what you‚Äôve built. Your application must include:
 



  





**A System Architecture You‚Äôre Proud Of** 




 Share a system architecture that you created or significantly contributed to. This can be:
 


* An architecture diagram (Miro, Excalidraw, Lucidchart, hand\\-drawn ‚Äî we don‚Äôt care about polish, we care about thinking).
* A one\\-page Word/PDF description explaining the system: what problem it solved, the key design decisions you made, trade\\-offs you navigated, and what you‚Äôd change if you rebuilt it today.
* Bonus: include metrics or outcomes (latency, throughput, uptime, cost savings, etc.).



  





*We want to understand how you decompose complex problems, make trade\\-offs under constraints, and communicate technical decisions. This is the single most important part of your application.* 




  





**WHY MARKOPOLO** 



* Work on a 709M\\-parameter behavioral foundation model (ATHENA) that predicts human actions before they happen ‚Äî real frontier AI, not wrapper products.
* Remote\\-first culture with hybrid flexibility (2 days in office, 3 days Work from home)
* Competitive compensation with equity options for full\\-time roles.
* Learn from a team pushing the boundaries of edge AI, model compression, and real\\-time behavioral intelligence.



  





**Ready to build the future of behavioral intelligence?** 




  





 Apply by sending your resume and the system architecture to
 **hr@markopolo.ai**

title: Software Engineer - C , Kerenel development , Device drivers
description:
**Meet the Team**
 At Data Center Business Unit at Cisco, we are dedicated to driving innovation in networking technologies. Our focus is on developing Ethernet Switching products that address the evolving needs of modern network infrastructures, including those in AI, cloud computing, and enterprise environments. In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn a wide range of core Ethernet Technologies with architectural exposure to craft and develop Ethernet Switching as applied to both Public and Private cloud infrastructure. You will work on the intricacies of the critically important infrastructure that enables the world\\-class, multi\\-layered Nexus switches. In addition, you will have the opportunity to participate in multi\\-functional collaboration and be exposed to all facets of the software development cycle from innovation, marketing requirement to product delivery.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 Data Center Networking Group develops the Nexus 9000 line of data center and cloud switches that feature application awareness to make the network infrastructure flexible and agile for dynamic response to application needs. Data Center team develops a 400G, 800G Ethernet switches, low latency switches and many features associated with it.
   

  

**Minimum Qualifications (Provide up to five (5\\) bullet points :**
* B.E/B.Tech from reputed university and having 5\\-10 years of software development experience in embedded systems
* Strong System programming skills in C and Sound background in Data structures and Algorithms.
* Hands on Engineer/leader who can work along with senior folks contributing to Architecture, design and development of platform development cycle
* Development experience on PCH and peripherals PCI, I2C, SPI, Higig\\+ bus, FPGA and CPLD handling, handling os special devices and peripherals ‚Äì I2C\\-GPIO expanders. Exposure to standards ‚Äì XAUI, SGMI, Serdes, SGMII, MSA
* Knowledge of asic bring up, low\\-level debugging, Linux drivers and 3rdparty ASICs/network processors highly desired.
* Excellent debugging skills and rich experience using various hardware, memory debugging tools


**Preferred Qualifications (Provide up to five (5\\) bullet points:** 
 these can include soft skills)
   

  

* Experience working on Scalable, Distributed Architectures a plus
* Strong written \\& verbal communication skills
* Working experience in merchant silicon
* Ability to multi\\-task and solve complex problems
* Consistent track record of learning new technologies and features on own initiative
* A demonstrable passion for technology and software development


 Why Cisco?
   

  

 At Cisco, we‚Äôre revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era ‚Äì and beyond. We‚Äôve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.
   

  

 Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you‚Äôll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.
   

  

 We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

title: Quality Assurance / Test Engineer Intern
description:
**Company Description**
  

 FSSSI Global Pvt. Ltd. is a multidisciplinary organization delivering integrated financial, legal, and innovative software solutions designed to meet the needs of modern businesses. Rooted in transparency and excellence, the company provides 360¬∞ business support, enabling compliance, operational efficiency, and digital transformation for clients across various industries. With a mission to foster growth through reliable technology\\-driven solutions, FSSSI Global is supported by a knowledgeable team of professionals in finance, technology, and legal domains. The company is committed to innovation, sustainability, and building value\\-driven partnerships to create smarter, more connected business ecosystems.
   

  

**Role Description**

The intern will execute functional testing, create and refine test cases, and collaborate with teams to ensure that software solutions meet quality standards. Additional responsibilities include supporting test engineering efforts, analyzing test results to identify issues, and contributing to maintaining robust software performance and reliability.

* Effective collaboration and communication skills to work in a team\\-oriented environment
* Basic knowledge or experience in software development and debugging is an advantage
* Currently pursuing or completed a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field

title: Software Engineer - C, Device Drivers, Kernel development, Bring up - 8 to 10 yrs
description:
**Meet the Team**
 At Data Center Business Unit at Cisco, we are dedicated to driving innovation in networking technologies. Our focus is on developing Ethernet Switching products that address the evolving needs of modern network infrastructures, including those in AI, cloud computing, and enterprise environments. In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn a wide range of core Ethernet Technologies with architectural exposure to craft and develop Ethernet Switching as applied to both Public and Private cloud infrastructure. You will work on the intricacies of the critically important infrastructure that enables the world\\-class, multi\\-layered Nexus switches. In addition, you will have the opportunity to participate in multi\\-functional collaboration and be exposed to all facets of the software development cycle from innovation, marketing requirement to product delivery.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 Data Center Networking Group develops the Nexus 9000 line of data center and cloud switches that feature application awareness to make the network infrastructure flexible and agile for dynamic response to application needs. Data Center team develops a 400G, 800G Ethernet switches, low latency switches and many features associated with it.
   

  

**Minimum Qualifications (Provide up to five (5\\) bullet points :**
* B.E/B.Tech from reputed university and having 8\\-12 years of software development experience in embedded systems
* Strong System programming skills in C and Sound background in Data structures and Algorithms.
* Hands on Engineer/leader who can work along with senior folks contributing to Architecture, design and development of platform development cycle
* Development experience on PCH and peripherals PCI, I2C, SPI, Higig\\+ bus, FPGA and CPLD handling, handling os special devices and peripherals ‚Äì I2C\\-GPIO expanders. Exposure to standards ‚Äì XAUI, SGMI, Serdes, SGMII, MSA
* Knowledge of asic bring up, low\\-level debugging, Linux drivers and 3rdparty ASICs/network processors highly desired.
* Excellent debugging skills and rich experience using various hardware, memory debugging tools


**Preferred Qualifications (Provide up to five (5\\) bullet points:** 
 these can include soft skills)
   

  

* Experience working on Scalable, Distributed Architectures a plus
* Strong written \\& verbal communication skills
* Working experience in merchant silicon
* Ability to multi\\-task and solve complex problems
* Consistent track record of learning new technologies and features on own initiative
* A demonstrable passion for technology and software development


 Why Cisco?
   

  

 At Cisco, we‚Äôre revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era ‚Äì and beyond. We‚Äôve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.
   

  

 Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you‚Äôll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.
   

  

 We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

title: Data Engineer
description:
IMEA (India, Middle East, Africa)
   

  

 India
   

  

 LIXIL INDIA PVT LTD
   

  

 Employee Assignment
   

  

 Fully remote possible
   

  

 Full Time
   

  

 1 May 2025
   

  

**Title**
 Data Engineer
   

  

**Job Description**
 A Data Engineer is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining large\\-scale data systems and infrastructure. Their primary goal is to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and retrieved to support business intelligence, analytics, and data\\-driven decision\\-making.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and Develop Data Pipelines: Create data pipelines to extract data from various sources, transform it into a standardized format, and load it into a centralized data repository.
* Build and Maintain Data Infrastructure: Design, implement, and manage data warehouses, data lakes, and other data storage solutions.
* Ensure Data Quality and Integrity: Develop data validation, cleansing, and normalization processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* Collaborate with Data Analysts and Business Process Owners: Work with data analysts and business process owners to understand their data requirements and provide data support for their projects.
* Optimize Data Systems for Performance: Continuously monitor and optimize data systems for performance, scalability, and reliability.
* Develop and Maintain Data Governance Policies: Create and enforce data governance policies to ensure data security, compliance, and regulatory requirements.


**Experience \\& Skills**
* Hands\\-on experience in implementing, supporting, and administering modern cloud\\-based data solutions (Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, Snowflake, etc.).
* Strong programming skills in SQL, Java, and Python.
* Experience in configuring and managing data pipelines using Apache Airflow, Informatica, Talend, SAP BODS or API\\-based extraction.
* Expertise in real\\-time data processing frameworks.
* Strong understanding of Git and CI/CD for automated deployment and version control.
* Experience with Infrastructure\\-as\\-Code tools like Terraform for cloud resource management.
* Good stakeholder management skills to collaborate effectively across teams.
* Solid understanding of SAP ERP data and processes to integrate enterprise data sources.
* Exposure to data visualization and front\\-end tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.).
* Strong command of English with excellent communication skills.

title: GCP Engineer (Pooling)
description:
**Job Requirements**
**Overview of the job**
 Data Engineer‚ÄìData Platforms
   

  

 This role reports to the Director, India Data Platforms, P\\&G
   

  

**About Data Platforms Team**
 We take pride in managing the most\\-valuable asset of company in Digital World, called Data. Our vision is to deliver Data as a competitive advantage for Asia Regional Business, by building unified data platforms, delivering customized BI tools for managers \\& empowering insightful business decisions through AI in Data. As a data solutions specialist, you'll be working closely with business stakeholders, collaborating to understand their needs and develop solutions to solve problems in area of supply chain, Sales \\& Distribution, Consumer Insights \\& Market performance.
   

  

 In this role, you'll be constantly learning, staying up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data solutions. You'll have the chance to work with a variety of tools and technologies, including big data platforms, machine learning frameworks, and data visualization tools, to build innovative and effective solutions.
   

  

 So, if you're excited about the possibilities of data, and eager to make a real impact in the world of business, a career in data solutions might be just what you're looking for. Join us and become a part of the future of digital transformation.
   

  

**About P\\&G IT**
 Digital is at the core of P\\&G‚Äôs accelerated growth strategy. With this vision, IT in P\\&G is deeply embedded into every critical process across business organizations comprising 11\\+ category units globally creating impactful value through Transformation, Simplification \\& Innovation. IT in P\\&G is sub\\-divided into teams that engage strongly for revolutionizing the business processes to deliver exceptional value \\& growth \\- Digital GTM, Digital Manufacturing, Marketing Technologist, Ecommerce, Data Sciences \\& Analytics, Data Solutions \\& Engineering, Product Supply.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Development of data and analytics cloud\\-based platform, including integrated systems and implementing ELT/ ETL jobs to fulfil business deliverables. Performing sophisticated data operations such as data orchestration, transformation, and visualization with large datasets. You will be working with product managers to ensure superior product delivery to drive business value \\& transformation. Demonstrating standard coding practices to ensure delivery excellence and reusability.
   

  

* Data Ingestion: Develop and maintain data pipelines to extract data from various sources and load it into Google Cloud environments.
* Data Transformation: Implement data transformation processes, including data cleansing, normalization, and aggregation, to ensure data quality and consistency.
* Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schemas to support efficient data storage and retrieval in Google Cloud platforms.
* Data Warehousing: Build data warehouses or data lakes using Google Cloud services such as Big Query.
* Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, both on\\-premises and cloud\\-based, using Cloud Composer or other relevant tools.
* Data Governance: Implement data governance practices, including data security, privacy, and compliance, to ensure data integrity and regulatory compliance.
* Performance Optimization: Optimize data pipelines and queries for improved performance and scalability in Google Cloud environments.
* Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitor data pipelines, identify and resolve performance issues, and troubleshoot data\\-related problems in collaboration with other teams.
* Data Visualization: Build BI reports to enable faster decision making.
* Collaboration: Work with product managers to ensure superior product delivery to drive business value \\& transformation
* Documentation: Document data engineering processes, data flows, and system configurations for future reference and knowledge sharing.


**Work Experience**
**Qualifications:**
* Experience: Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data engineering, or a related field, along with 2\\+ year work experience in data engineering and cloud platforms.
* Google Cloud Development: Strong proficiency in Google Cloud services such as Spanner, Cloud Composers, Looker Studio, etc.
* ETL Tools: Experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tools and frameworks, such as Spark and Cloud Composer/Airflow for data integration and transformation.
* Programming: Proficiency in programming languages such as PySpark, Python, and SQL for data manipulation, scripting, and automation.
* Data Modeling: Knowledge of data modeling techniques and experience with data modeling tools.
* Database Technologies: Familiarity with relational databases (e.g., Cloud SQL) for data storage and retrieval.
* Data Warehousing: Understanding of data warehousing concepts, dimensional modeling, and experience with data warehousing technologies such as Big Query.
* Data Governance: Knowledge of data governance principles, data security, privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA), and experience implementing data governance practices.
* Data Visualization: Experience of working with Looker Studio to build semantic data model \\& BI reports/dashboards.
* Cloud Computing: Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and experience working with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform.
* Problem\\-Solving: Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills to identify and resolve data\\-related issues.
* Proficiency in DevOps Tools and CICD tools (e.g. Terraform, Github)
* Familiarity to Azure, Databricks and its relevant tech stacks would be an advantage to the role.

title: Senior Developer
description:

 Employment Type: Full\\-time

 About the Role
 



  





 We are looking for a Tech Delivery Lead who can take ownership of technical delivery while remaining hands\\-on. This role is ideal for strong engineers who want to step into delivery leadership early in their career, working in a fast\\-moving startup environment while building enterprise\\-grade systems.
 



  





 Fast\\-track into delivery leadership early in your career‚Äîhigh ownership, strong mentorship, and enterprise\\-grade engineering standards.
 



  





 Think speed, accountability, and real impact‚Äîwithout compromising on quality, reliability, or scale.
 



 We are a BITSian\\-founded startup, with a strong engineering culture and a bias toward execution.
 



  





 Why This Role Is Different
 



  





 Fast\\-track into delivery leadership early in your career with real ownership
 



 Startup pace, but enterprise\\-level expectations (quality, reliability, observability)
 



 Strong mentorship while leading modules or small projects
 



 Engineering\\-led culture with minimal bureaucracy
 



 Opportunity to build and ship production AI/LLM systems, not experiments
 



  





 Key Responsibilities

 Tech Stack (What You‚Äôll Work With)

 The exact tech mix depends on the project‚Äîengineers are encouraged to choose the right tools and evolve the stack responsibly.
 



  





 Required Skills \\& Experience
 



  





 2‚Äì5 years of hands\\-on software development experience

 Good to Have

 Startup Culture at ThinkByte
 



  





 Flat hierarchy, high trust, and clear ownership
 



 Move fast, but build for scale and reliability
 



 Strong focus on learning, accountability, and execution
 



 Founded and led by BITS alumni, with a culture of meritocracy

title: Software Principal Engineer-Java & Python, Distributed Systems
description:
**Software Principal Engineer**
 The Software Engineering team delivers next\\-generation software application enhancements and new products for a changing world. Working at the cutting edge, we design and develop software for platforms, peripherals, applications and diagnostics ‚Äî all with the most advanced technologies, tools, software engineering methodologies and the collaboration of internal and external partners.
   

  

 Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a
 **Software Principal Engineer** 
 on our
 **Software Engineering** 
 Team in
 **Bangalore.**
**What You‚Äôll Achieve**
 As a Software Principal Engineer, you will be responsible for developing sophisticated systems and software basis the customer‚Äôs business goals, needs and general business environment creating software solutions. We build enterprise\\-grade, massively scalable storage systems‚Äîclustered, high\\-performance, and resilient‚Äîrunning across Linux and BSD. Our portfolio includes a multi\\-petabyte S3 object store and a scale\\-out NAS platform. We‚Äôre a modern, scrum\\-based engineering org that ships with high velocity and quality, using the best tools, hardware, and practices.
   

  

**You will:**
* Design and build next\\-generation AI data platform storage \\- mission\\-critical components powering our AI strategy‚Äîgiving you the opportunity to tackle state\\-of\\-the\\-art problems in scale, performance, and reliability.
* Own problems end\\-to\\-end across design, implementation, testing, deployment, and supportability‚Äîwithin a cluster storage system.
* Build and harden distributed services: durability, consistency, replication, data paths, metadata, control planes, scheduling, placement, and lifecycle management.
* Optimize performance across computer, memory, IO, networking (including RDMA), and storage media (NVMe/SSD/HDD/AFA); drive latency and throughput improvements with data\\-driven profiling and advance reliability through observability, telemetry, failure injection, chaos testing, and automated remediation; raise the bar on serviceability and supportability.
* Collaborate in scrum teams; write clear design docs, PRDs, and RFCs; perform code reviews and mentor peers. Raise product quality via automated tests, CI/CD pipelines, build hygiene, and release engineering \\& Contribute to security \\& compliance (TLS, authN/Z, crypto, FIPS, STIG/NIST best practices) and secure\\-by\\-default engineering.


**Essential Requirements**
* 8 \\- 12 years of experience in systems programming and distributed systems fundamentals (concurrency, networking, storage, consistency, fault tolerance).
* Proficiency in at least one of C/C\\+\\+ OR Java and Python (good to have); willingness to learn across the stack.
* Experience with Linux or BSD development and debugging (e.g., performance, strace/dtrace/eBPF, tcpdump).
* Ability to write clean, testable code; familiarity with unit/integration/system testing and CI/CD.
* Must have experience designing subsystems, leading cross\\-team feature delivery, setting quality bars, improving observability and performance, and driving root\\-cause and reliability initiatives with clear communication, collaboration, and a bias for action


**Desirable Requirements**
* Systems \\& Performance Engineering: Expertise in kernel subsystems, device drivers, firmware; RDMA/verbs; SPDK/DPDK; JVM tuning and GC; async/reactive patterns; lock\\-free/concurrent data structures; filesystem internals (NFS/SMB, S3 object store, erasure coding); observability stacks, performance profiling at scale, and chaos/failure injection.
* Security \\& Cloud Platforms: Skilled in security and cryptography (FIPS/CC compliance), secure boot, TPM, HSM integrations; experienced with private and public cloud environments including Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Amazon Web Services (AWS) \\& exposure or usage of AI tools to build code/design is big plus.


**Who We Are**
 We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That‚Äôs why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you‚Äôre looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we‚Äôre looking for you.
   

  

 Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.
   

  

**Application closing date: 15 Feb 2026**
 Dell Technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.
   

  

 \\#NJP

title: AI Builder
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
**We are hiring: AI Builder (Not a traditional developer role)** 




  





 We are looking for a smart problem\\-solver who likes building things fast, not someone who only writes traditional software code. This role is for people who already use AI tools daily and are comfortable learning by experimenting.
 



  





**What you'll actually do** 




  




* Build small external tools using AI
* Automate business workflows (support, sales, operations)
* Connect apps and APIs (payments, WhatsApp, dashboards, IoT devices)
* Prototype new ideas quickly
* Help us turn rough ideas into working systems



  





 You won‚Äôt spend months writing perfect code. You will spend days making useful things work.
 



  





**Tools you might already play with:** 



* Claude Code, Cursor, Copilot, APIs, Webhooks, Python/JS basics, Docker, GIT, Make, Airtable any combination is fine. You do
 **not** 
 need to know everything



  





**You'll probably enjoy this role, if you have ever** 



* automated something for fun
* built a bot or scraper
* connected two apps together
* used AI to create a working tool or mini\\-app
* stayed up late trying to ‚Äúsee if this is possible‚Äù



  





**What we DO NOT care about** 



* Computer science degree
* Big company experience
* Years of experience
* LeetCode or competitive coding



**What we DO care about** 



* Clear thinking
* Speed of learning
* Ability to independently figure things out
* Comfort using AI as a daily tool



  





**To Apply** 




 Send the following to
 **impact@zevpoint.com** 
 :
 



**Anything you have built:** 
 A link or 1\\-minute video/screenshot of a tool or automation you built with the idea on how you built it and and how long it took you
 



  





**Zevpoint Practical Thinking Challenge:** 
 After you apply, we will send you a small real\\-world problem to think about. There is no coding test and no trick questions. We simply want to understand how you approach unfamiliar situations.

title: Applied Scientist
description:
**Company Overview**
 Accrete AI is a dynamic and innovative company focused on transforming the future of artificial intelligence. We specialize in creating advanced AI solutions that turn complex data into actionable insights, driving real\\-world impact for businesses and government organizations. Our team thrives on creativity and collaboration, working together to push the boundaries of AI technology.
   

  

 At the core of our offerings are AI agents‚Äîautonomous systems that analyze multimodal data, generate insights, and make intelligent recommendations. These agents help businesses streamline operations, improve decision\\-making, and empower government entities to enhance security, intelligence, and operational efficiency.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As an Applied Research Engineer, you will design, build, and operationalize advanced AI systems, working alongside AI scientists to turn research ideas into high\\-impact models and agentic workflows, and alongside engineering teams to integrate those capabilities into production platforms. You will work across NLP, computer vision, multimodal models, and agent\\-based systems, owning the path from experimental prototypes to scalable, reliable components. This role values strong hands\\-on engineering, fluency with modern AI models and tooling, and the judgment to balance innovation with performance, robustness, and real\\-world constraints.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, implement, and operationalize advanced AI models and agentic workflows, translating research ideas into robust, production\\-ready systems.
* Work closely with AI scientists to prototype, experiment, and evaluate models across NLP, computer vision, multimodal learning, and agent\\-based systems.
* Partner with machine learning engineers and application teams to integrate research artifacts into products, services, and platforms.
* Build and optimize model pipelines, inference workflows, and tooling with attention to performance, scalability, and reliability.
* Contribute to model evaluation, benchmarking, and validation, ensuring research outputs meet real\\-world constraints and quality standards.
* Support the deployment, monitoring, and iteration of AI models, helping systems evolve as data, requirements, and environments change.
* Stay current with advances in AI and machine learning, applying new techniques where they meaningfully improve system capabilities.
* Contribute to a culture of high\\-quality engineering, including code reviews, documentation, testing, and knowledge sharing.


**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related field with 2\\+ years of hands\\-on experience building AI/ML systems; or a Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field.
* Strong software engineering skills in Python, with experience implementing and maintaining AI or ML\\-driven systems.
* Practical experience working with modern AI models, including large language models, deep learning models for natural language processing or computer vision systems.
* Experience developing agentic or tool\\-using AI workflows, including orchestration, reasoning loops, or pipeline\\-based execution.
* Familiarity in model training, fine\\-tuning, and evaluation, and the ability to collaborate effectively with research scientists.
* Experience deploying AI or ML components into production or near\\-production environments, with awareness of performance, reliability, and scaling considerations.
* Comfort working across the stack with machine learning engineers and application teams to operationalize research outputs.
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and the ability to quickly learn new models, tools, and systems.
* Clear communication skills and the ability to work effectively in cross\\-functional teams.


**Career Progression**
 At Accrete we value professional growth and development of our employees. As a Staff Product Operations Specialist, you will have access to a variety of career advancement opportunities and growth within the organization. We provide ongoing training, mentorship, and opportunities to take on leadership roles within your team and work with leaders across departments.
   

  

**Why Join Us**
* Innovative Environment: Be part of a team that's at the forefront of technological innovation, utilizing GenAI and ML to create groundbreaking solutions.
* Collaborative Culture: Work in a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued, and you have the opportunity to make a real impact.
* Professional Growth: We're committed to your professional growth and development, offering opportunities for learning and advancement.
* Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive compensation and benefits package, including medical insurance.


*Join us at Accrete (https://www.accrete.ai/) and be part of our team. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey of innovation and growth!*
